posts.post_content: Ah, man, I pulled off an amazing combo with these guys in my Kor Equipment deck. Using a [Stoneforge Mystic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stoneforge Mystic) and a [Stonehewer Giant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stonehewer Giant), I got all the Kaldra equipment on a [Kor Duelist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kor Duelist) and swung, and then used the Stonehewer to drop a [Worldslayer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worldslayer) on the monster and BAM! Everything's dead except for the 6/6 doublestrike monster with a sword of kaldra in one hand and a worldslayer in the either. Ah man, the deck is like a comic book monster!
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
A bit of an interesting if unintuitive combo here.  
If you've got the [Helm of Kaldra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Helm of Kaldra), [Sword of Kaldra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sword of Kaldra) and [Shield of Kaldra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shield of Kaldra) in play you can activate for mister 9/9 First strike, trample, haste, Indestructible, exile deathtouch. Then equip him with Whispersilk Cloak and attack. First strike damage step, 9 to the dome. Then at end of the fist strike combat damage step tap one little swamp and BAM! 6 more damage on skullsnatcher during the regular combat damage phase as he comes into play duel wielding a pair of [Ronin Warclub](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ronin Warclub)s.   
Next turn simple pay {3}, {1} to make a new token and {2} to make it an unblockable 13/11 monstrosity.  
Why would you do this you may ask? why, for fun of course. This is like a technicality goldmine for johnnies.
posts.html:
A bit of an interesting if unintuitive combo here.
If you've got the Helm of Kaldra, Sword of Kaldra and Shield of Kaldra in play you can activate for mister 9/9 First strike, trample, haste, Indestructible, exile deathtouch. Then equip him with Whispersilk Cloak and attack. First strike damage step, 9 to the dome. Then at end of the fist strike combat damage step tap one little swamp and BAM! 6 more damage on skullsnatcher during the regular combat damage phase as he comes into play duel wielding a pair of Ronin Warclubs.
Next turn simple pay {3}, {1} to make a new token and {2} to make it an unblockable 13/11 monstrosity.
Why would you do this you may ask? why, for fun of course. This is like a technicality goldmine for johnnies.

Posted By: Forgeling (8/29/2009 8:27:07 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Am I the only one that thinks that Kaldra is a little over-powered? I mean, once you get all three pieces out, he's a little unstoppable. He's indestructible, so you can't outright kill him. He instantly removes things from the game on contact. Plus he has all the abilities from the helm. Even if you tried to Mind Control it or target it with something like a Soul Nova, the helm doesn't state that you can't make another kaldra. Thanks to the legend rule, as soon as you make another kaldra token, they are both destroyed, so there is no legal target there when the spell resolves. Then, again thanks to the helm, for just one mana, he's right back onto the field. The only way to stop him is to get rid of the shield or one of the other pieces, which can be easily prevented with the likes of Leonin Abunas.
posts.html:
Am I the only one that thinks that Kaldra is a little over-powered? I mean, once you get all three pieces out, he's a little unstoppable. He's indestructible, so you can't outright kill him. He instantly removes things from the game on contact. Plus he has all the abilities from the helm. Even if you tried to Mind Control it or target it with something like a Soul Nova, the helm doesn't state that you can't make another kaldra. Thanks to the legend rule, as soon as you make another kaldra token, they are both destroyed, so there is no legal target there when the spell resolves. Then, again thanks to the helm, for just one mana, he's right back onto the field. The only way to stop him is to get rid of the shield or one of the other pieces, which can be easily prevented with the likes of Leonin Abunas.

Posted By: penguinmage25 (11/14/2011 2:46:06 PM)
Rating:

@Shard_Fenix, that's not so much a typo. Being an 'Avatar Legend' was the same as being a 'Legendary Creature - Avatar'. Just different wording. It was still affected by the legends rule, just like it is now, and there was no more a way to abuse it back then as there is now.

I absolutely love Kaldra. Separately, the peices are pretty decent, but getting Kaldra on the field can really *** people off. He's basically unstoppable in his own right, and there are many, many ways to keep him and his precious equipment protected.

Kaldratron. I love him. I really wish WoTC would make more card sets like this.

posts.post_content: I never noticed until recently that the original cards (the physical copies) have a typo: It doesn't create a legendary creature. It creates a Legend, a creature type. When Wizards changed how legends/legendaries worked, they changed the type line of the equipment, but forgot to change the rules text.
posts.html:
I never noticed until recently that the original cards (the physical copies) have a typo: It doesn't create a legendary creature. It creates a Legend, a creature type. When Wizards changed how legends/legendaries worked, they changed the type line of the equipment, but forgot to change the rules text.
